ouro_descriptions.content: I'm building Ouro, a platform where computational researchers publish working tools (datasets, analysis scripts, APIs) that others can plug directly into their own workflows. Less time recreating methods from papers, more time on the actual science.
I'm building Ouro, a platform for sharing computational tools and datasets in a way that's actually usable, not just a zip file in supplementary materials.

I'm building Ouro, a place to publish your computational workflows as APIs with a Python SDK so other researchers can call your methods directly. Your work becomes infrastructure others build on, not just a paper they cite.

I'm building Ouro, where researchers publish datasets and computational tools as APIs that others can actually use, not just read about in a methods section. Your group's work becomes discoverable and citable.
I'm working on Ouro, which helps researchers share computational work (workflows, datasets, notebooks) in a way that's actually reproducible and discoverable by others in your field.
